overall_goal: Master the fundamentals of convection heat and mass transfer, focusing on boundary layers, dimensionless parameters, and analogies.

core_concepts.name: Boundary Layers
core_concepts.explanation: Velocity, thermal, and concentration boundary layers describe the regions near a surface where flow properties change significantly.
core_concepts.importance: Critical for understanding heat and mass transfer mechanisms in fluid flow.
examples: Temperature gradient near a heated plate

core_concepts.name: Dimensionless Parameters
core_concepts.explanation: Parameters like Reynolds (Re), Prandtl (Pr), Schmidt (Sc), and Nusselt (Nu) numbers characterize flow and transport phenomena.
core_concepts.importance: Enable scaling and comparison of different systems.

core_concepts.name: Heat and Mass Transfer Analogies
core_concepts.explanation: Relationships between heat and mass transfer coefficients based on similarity of governing equations.
core_concepts.importance: Simplifies analysis when both heat and mass transfer occur.

resource.description: Covers practical applications of boundary layer theory.

general_tip: Active Learning: Derive equations instead of memorizing.
Visual Aids: Sketch boundary layer profiles to visualize concepts.
Time Management: Balance theory (1 hour) and problem-solving (1 hour) each day.

key_formulas.name: Reynolds Number (Re)
key_formulas.description: Ratio of inertial forces to viscous forces in fluid flow.
key_formulas.usage_context: Used to predict flow regimes (laminar/turbulent) and analyze boundary layer behavior.

key_formulas.name: Prandtl Number (Pr)
key_formulas.description: Ratio of momentum diffusivity to thermal diffusivity.
key_formulas.usage_context: Determines relative thickness of velocity and thermal boundary layers.

key_formulas.name: Schmidt Number (Sc)
key_formulas.description: Ratio of momentum diffusivity to mass diffusivity.
key_formulas.usage_context: Analyzes mass transfer problems and concentration boundary layers.

key_formulas.name: Nusselt Number (Nu)
key_formulas.description: Ratio of convective to conductive heat transfer at a boundary.
key_formulas.usage_context: Quantifies heat transfer enhancement due to convection.

key_formulas.name: Reynolds Analogy
key_formulas.description: Relates momentum transfer to heat transfer in turbulent flow.
key_formulas.usage_context: Simplifies calculation of heat transfer coefficients from friction factors.

key_formulas.name: Sherwood Number (Sh)
key_formulas.description: Mass transfer equivalent of the Nusselt number.
key_formulas.usage_context: Quantifies mass transfer enhancement due to convection.

key_formulas.name: Lewis Number (Le)
key_formulas.description: Ratio of thermal diffusivity to mass diffusivity.
key_formulas.usage_context: Relates heat and mass transfer boundary layers in simultaneous processes.

key_formulas.name: Evaporative Cooling Effect
key_formulas.description: Heat flux due to phase change at a surface.
key_formulas.usage_context: Calculates cooling effects in applications like sweating or anti-icing systems.
